image.altText: A member of parliament on his feet in the chamber to ask a question while holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

title.children: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days

image.altText: A large crack in a concrete slab.

props.synopsis: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

title.children: Outback city rumbles through a record year of ground shaking

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and tattoos on her arm wearing a black singlet smiles while sitting at a bar

props.synopsis: Police say they have "grave concerns" for a woman who has not been seen for more than two weeks in outback South Australia.

title.children: New search for missing 41-year-old woman in outback SA

image.altText: driver lifting two fingers from a car steering wheel

props.synopsis: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

title.children: Experiment shows uncertain future for courtesy wave

image.altText: A young man in blue walking with head down

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

title.children: Man charged with Tim Picton assault granted bail

image.altText: A man holding a cricket shirt in front of a beach.

props.synopsis: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

title.children: 'They were a band of brothers': The largely untold story of Australia's first touring cricket team

image.altText: Anthony Nocera arms crossed against a dark background on location at State Theatre South Australia

props.synopsis: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

title.children: Rising SA playwright's late fiance 'lives on' in emotional theatre debut

image.altText: GettyImages-2253824052

props.synopsis: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest "battle of the sexes". The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

title.children: 'Happy it's over': Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka in new 'battle of the sexes'

image.altText: Dairy cows stand behind a fence.

props.synopsis: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.

title.children: Emerging virtual fencing tech could help save cattle trapped in bushfires

image.altText: A graphic showing a vial of the Mounjaro weight loss drug next to three Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

title.children: 'Pesky Aussie laws' comment sparks scrutiny of weight-loss treatment marketing

image.altText: An old barn with a cracked floor and gutted out on the left, refurbished with lights and bar on the right.

props.synopsis: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

title.children: Historic riverside Nor' West Bend open to public after decades of restoration

image.altText: sign along the Broome-Cape Leveque road

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Hayley is upgraded to a category four system as it nears the northern WA coast.

title.children: Cyclone Hayley strengthens as it closes in on Kimberley coast

image.altText: A media pack surrounds mourners at Bondi Beach in the days after the terror attack.

props.synopsis: It was a year that bought us a federal election, ongoing war in the Middle East and Ukraine and a trial in a small Victorian town watched keenly around the world.

title.children: A cyclone, the mushroom killer and terror at Bondi: Your most read stories

image.altText: A man running.

props.synopsis: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

title.children: Bystanders fight off alleged Melbourne carjacker

image.altText: Josh Burns stands in a corridor at Parliament House

props.synopsis: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

title.children: Josh Burns on juggling politics, fatherhood and being a Jewish MP

image.altText: Household plastic recycling

props.synopsis: Australia's first large-scale soft plastics recycling facility is processing huge loads each day, turning waste into a useful raw material.

title.children: Your soft plastic bags can once again be recycled. Here's how

image.altText: An aerial shot of Wivenhoe Dam gates taken at sunrise

props.synopsis: South-east Queensland's largest water reservoir provides drinking water and protection from flooding. So, how does it all work?

title.children: Inside south-east Queensland's largest water reservoir Wivenhoe Dam

image.altText: President Trump and President Zelenskyy shake hands in front of the US and Ukrainian flags.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has held talks with US President Donald Trump, and says he would prefer a commitment of 50 years.

title.children: US offers Ukraine 15-year security guarantee as part of peace plan

image.altText: A man photographed walking down the street

props.synopsis: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, Harrison survived the attack by a knife-wielding attacker, though Harrison's friends and family speculated it ultimately hastened his death less than two years later.

title.children: How history nearly repeated for a Beatle at the hands of a troubled fan

image.altText: A telescope on a hill, backlit by the Milky Way across the night sky.

props.synopsis: From dire wolves to dementia risk, this quiz will test your knowledge on some of the biggest science news stories of the year.

title.children: Quiz: Were you paying attention to the big scientific discoveries of 2025?

image.altText: composite image of Kerry Greenwood, Pope Francis and David Stratton

props.synopsis: From actors and designers to a Holocaust survivor and a broadcaster, these people made their mark.

title.children: Remembering the celebrities and public figures who died in 2025

image.altText: Ahmed Al Ahmed in a white shirt, sitting for an interview

props.synopsis: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

title.children: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed who wrestled gunman shares his story

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

title.children: PM announces terms for review of Bondi terror attack

image.altText: A curator talks to an official as they look at the pitch during a break in a cricket Test at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

title.children: ICC hands down punishment for 'unsatisfactory' MCG pitch

image.altText: A graphic showing a vial of the Mounjaro weight loss drug next to three Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

title.children: 'Pesky Aussie laws' comment sparks scrutiny of weight-loss treatment marketing

image.altText: Emma Johnston smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

title.children: Family, colleagues in 'disbelief' after leading scientist dies aged 52

image.altText: A man with a dark beard wearing a checked shirt sitting in the front passenger seat of a car alongside another man.

props.synopsis: In a statement, the Palestinian militant group also confirmed the death of spokesman Abu Ubaida.

title.children: Hamas confirms death of former leader, believed to have died in May

image.altText: Words reading "Artificial intelligence AI", miniature of robot and toy hand are pictured

props.synopsis: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

title.children: Certainty in the rearview mirror as 2025 economy goes wild

image.altText: An aerial view of a white cruise ship stranded on a patch of reef surrounded by deeper water near a small island.

props.synopsis: Passengers on the Australian cruise ship stranded off the coast of Papua New Guinea will be flown out of the country after efforts to refloat the vessel failed.

title.children: Stranded passengers to fly home from PNG after failed efforts to free cruise ship

image.altText: Lizzy is sitting on the ground looking up at the TV, which is showing an image of a woman and a dog walking along the beach.

props.synopsis: Looking for screen-time options that won't leave your kids overstimulated? 'Slow TV' shows, with their soothing visuals and soundtracks, could be the answer.

title.children: Help the kids unwind with 'slow TV' that promotes quiet and calm

image.altText: A large sail boat with crew in rough seas.

props.synopsis: Those now safely onshore after finishing the 2025 Sydney to Hobart tell of "horrendous" conditions, resulting in injuries, broken boats and seasickness — even among experienced crew members.

title.children: 'You're levitating': Sailors tell of 'horrendous' ordeal in yacht race

image.altText: A woman working in a noddle shop looking at the TV.

props.synopsis: China has moved its military to surround Taiwan warning against its independence. But Beijing's action has been condemned by Taiwan calling for regional peace and de-escalation.

title.children: China launches military exercise warning against Taiwan independence

image.altText: Blue fishing overalls with writing on them.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.

title.children: Protesters unite for 'stinky display' against demersal fishing ban

image.altText: Leetona Dungay (right) stands with her family near an 'Always will be Aboriginal land' banner

props.synopsis: A decade after his death in a Sydney prison, David Dungay Jr's family hold with a memorial rally calling for change to a corrections system they say still fails to protect Indigenous people.

title.children: Mother's fight for change continues 10 years after son's death in custody

image.altText: Climber Sarah Larcombe hanging by her arms off a rock wall. The Australian outback is in the background.

props.synopsis: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

title.children: After Sarah Larcombe fell off Arapiles, healing her bones was just the beginning
